item.description:
Half of a Yellow Sun by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie


Adichie illuminates a seminal moment in modern African history: Biafra's impassioned struggle to establish an independent republic in southeastern Nigeria during the late 1960s. We experience this tumultuous decade alongside five unforgettable characters: Ugwu, a thirteen-year-old houseboy who works for Odenigbo, a university professor full of revolutionary zeal; Olanna, the professor’s beautiful young mistress who has abandoned her life in Lagos for a dusty town and her lover’s charm; and Richard, a shy young Englishman infatuated with Olanna’s willful twin sister Kainene. Half of a Yellow Sun is a tremendously evocative novel of the promise, hope, and disappointment of the Biafran war. 

 

 

The next few book selections will be chosen by:
February - Dwain
March - Wei
April - Elizabeth

Have a book suggestion for an upcoming meetup?
Add it to the South Shore discussion on the Bulletin Board here. 

Read the book if you're planning to come.  Be a participant, not a spectator.
item.name: Quincy: Half of a Yellow Sun
